definition: quick decision
fast/rapid/quick/velocity
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly
a blitzkrieg strategy (idiom)/to resolve sth in the shortest time possible/to get sth done quickly

sentences.english: The quick, decisive victory that Napoleon expected never happened.
sentences.chinese: 拿破崙期盼着的速決速勝遲遲沒有發生。

sentences.english: She had a strong will and power of rapid decision.
sentences.chinese: 她具有堅強的意志和速決的才能。

sentences.english: Women love quickies as much as men do.
sentences.chinese: 女人和男人一樣喜歡速戰速決。

sentences.english: So the sword male plan to kill the villagers, to ensure a quick victory of the war.
sentences.chinese: 於是劍雄打算殺了那些村名，以保證戰爭速戰速決。

sentences.english: Being an aggressive baseliner, he is also known for finishing off his opponents quickly.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位底線攻擊型球員，以速戰速決著稱。

sentences.english: If we want to win the war, we have to combine quickly decided battles with lasting confrontations.
sentences.chinese: 要想打贏這場戰爭，就要把速決戰和持久戰結合起來。

definition: lit. a thief crying "Stop the thief!" (idiom)/fig. to accuse sb of a theft and try to sneak away oneself/to cover up one's misdeeds by shifting the blame onto others
(idiom) to lose one's head/to panic/to go to pieces
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
to whisper to one another's ear
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
to make a terrible scene (idiom)/to throw a tantrum
pinyin: yi1 ku1 er4 nao4 san1 shang4 diao4

definition: variant of 敢做敢當|敢做敢当[gan3 zuo4 gan3 dang1]
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: trivial matter/a piece of cake
to bow before (idiom)/to capitulate
extreme benevolence, utmost duty (idiom); meticulous virtue and attention to duty
protective coloration/camouflage
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
to let emotions affect one's decisions
